quest.name: To Make Amends
journal: Konogg is still looking considerably worse for his sister's absence.

Konogg, still inconsolable following the disappearance of his sister Anogg, explains that little has changed in Komra since last you spoke. This indeed seems to be the case, as several of the same villagers who previously spoke out against the twins soon arrive to further express their disgruntlement. Among them is a man you have not seen before, who hastens to chastise Konogg for his culpability in the tragedy that led to his wife's severe injury. Your dwarven friend is visibly shaken, and dissolves into tears on the spot.

With some effort and a few gentle pats on the back, you succeed in raising Konogg's spirits somewhat. He is determined to find a way to help the man and his wife, but fears that he will have little luck determining what might improve their situation while the other villagers are so ill-disposed toward civil conversation with him. Naturally, you volunteer to make inquiries in his stead.

You speak with two of the dwarves you saw previously, rightly guessing that they would have some idea of what might be of comfort to the injured parties. The answer─perhaps predictably─is alcohol, with mead being the beverage of choice.

Konogg is happy enough to seize upon the idea of a gift of mead for lack of any better ones, though the two of you soon realize that, with the village's liquor stores having gone up in flames, you will need to travel to Stilltide to purchase it. His sense of duty guides Konogg to insist on making the journey himself─with you as a guide, of course.
You meet Konogg outside of Komra to explain the route you will be taking to Stilltide. Despite the unfortunate circumstances surrounding it─or perhaps because of them─he seems eager to make the trip.
Konogg halts at the top of the Ladder to take in the sights. If they do not provide the enlightenment he seeks, perhaps you can.

At Konogg's insistence, you regale him with the tale of how you and the people of Norvrandt restored the massive device to functionality. It is unclear whether he is more inspired or intimidated by this, but in any case, he presses on.

Fortunately, you have not provided Konogg with detailed information on the location of the Leaky Keel, so he cannot dash away the moment you alight from the Ladder. Once you confirm the direction of your destination; however, he is filled with vigor at the prospect of nearing his goal, and does just that.

You find Konogg mentally fortifying himself outside the Leaky Keel. Whether he is intimidated at the prospect of entering an establishment so far from his village or simply trying to remember how to make a polite request after so long bossing an indulgent adventurer around is anyone's guess. Fortunately, he has no cause to worry, as Theva is charmed by his earnestness and kindly brings him a bottle of her finest mead.
Mead in hand, Konogg takes the lead back to the village. Unable to know what kind of reception the gift will earn, you elect to take him up on his offer to join him as he delivers it.

Konogg attempts to deliver the mead along with heartfelt sentiments, but the injured woman's husband will have none of it. His hopes of helping in some small way thoroughly dashed, Konogg flees, more distressed than ever.

As you attempt to chase down Konogg, you come upon a discarded bottle of mead─and then the dig site chief, who tells you that he but moments ago saw Konogg fleeing toward the crater. He asks that you continue your pursuit with haste, as the dwarf is in no state to be wandering around such a dangerous location.
Though you travel a fair distance into the Puppets' Bunker, you see no sign of Konogg. He must have been running as fast as his tiny legs could carry him.
You proceed to the command room, but still have yet to find Konogg─a worrying state of affairs indeed.

Deep within the alien ship, you at last locate Konogg...communing with a mysterious orb. The Echo provides some insight into the situation, though perhaps not as much as one would like: Anogg was caught in a rockslide and tumbled to the bottom of a cliff, only for her─or something identical─to appear before Konogg when he happened upon the strange white orb you now see. This raises a variety of vital questions, but as Konogg's safety is paramount, you convince him to return to the village for the time being.
Konogg insists that he is fine, despite being quite clearly anything but. It appears unlikely that you will get much else out of him.

You report what you have seen to the dig site chief, who assures you─and himself─that Anogg is surely alive and well, and will like as not return soon enough. He asks that you keep mum on the subject of the orb until Konogg has had time to recover, that there be no further cause for panic among the villagers.
objectives: Speak with villagers that are a likely source of gossip.
Speak with Konogg at Top Rung.
Speak with Konogg in Stilltide. (This time, with feeling.)
Search for Konogg in the crater.
Search for Konogg in the command room.
Speak with the dig site chief.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Here to see me? I appreciate it, but...

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: I'm afraid I don't have much to tell you. There's still no sign of Anogg, and the villagers are...well, you know how they are.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Can't blame them, really. 2P used us─she said as much─but we were the ones who allowed ourselves to be manipulated. I keep thinking about what we might have done differently...

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It serves no one to dwell on what could have been.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: You can't change what you've done, but you can change what you do now.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: You're right. I have to fix this, somehow. Or at least try.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: What are you lazing about here for, Konogg? Where's Anogg?

dialogue.name: VILLAGERA03954
dialogue.text: She's still up to no good, I bet! And run off before we could make her own up to it!

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Don't be ridiculous! Anogg, she's...

dialogue.name: VILLAGERG03954
dialogue.text: She's what?

dialogue.name: VILLAGERG03954
dialogue.text: Go on. Explain to us where exactly Anogg is.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERG03954
dialogue.text: Because I'll tell you where my wife is... She's at death's door because of the injuries she suffered in the attack!

dialogue.name: VILLAGERG03954
dialogue.text: Even if she wakes, she may never make a full recovery...

dialogue.name: VILLAGERG03954
dialogue.text: So if you know what's good for you, you'll get out of this village before I do something we'll both regret.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: <sob>

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Konogg seems in dire need of comfort.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: I...<sniff> I...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Konogg is openly weeping. Someone ought to comfort him.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: <sniff> ...Sorry. I really shouldn't be wallowing.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: I wish I could do something to help...for that man and his wife, especially.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: But I don't know either of them well, and I doubt anyone is willing to talk to me now...

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I'll ask around for you.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I'll see what I can do. But you owe me─double if anyone punches me in the face.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Really? Thank you!

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: With a bit of luck, they'll open up to you. If there's anything I can do to make things better, anything at all...

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: In the meantime, I'll find another way to make myself useful. It's not as if there's a shortage of rubble that needs clearing around here.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: I'm sure I can be of some use...somehow...

dialogue.name: VILLAGERB03954
dialogue.text: Look who it is. I hope you're not up to more mischief with Anogg and Konogg.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERB03954
dialogue.text: A woman with severe injuries and an angry husband... Yes, I know who you mean.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERB03954
dialogue.text: I doubt there's much to be done, but I won't stop you from trying. Those two have always been inseparable─I don't think I've ever seen them not holding hands. Can't imagine how he's feeling, now that she's in such a state.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERB03954
dialogue.text: You're friends with the poor dears, aren't you?

dialogue.name: VILLAGERD03954
dialogue.text: The very best of friends. And how I long for those days we drank away, without a care in the world! She always loved the mead...we all did...

dialogue.name: VILLAGERD03954
dialogue.text: <sniff> It was good mead...

dialogue.name: VILLAGERB03954
dialogue.text: ...That it was. There, there.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERB03954
dialogue.text: Perhaps someday we'll be able to go back to the way things used to be.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERD03954
dialogue.text: No...I'll never have that kind of peace of mind again.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: They talked to you? And no one got violent?

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Mead? I suppose we are dwarves, so maybe it's not such a terrible idea. <sigh> But as far as I know, none of our stores survived the attack.

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Down the cliff we go, then.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: We can buy more in Stilltide.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Oh! If there's some available for purchase, I'd happily spend the coin. Can you show me the way?

dialogue.name: Q4
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: I could go myself.

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: It's too dangerous for you out there.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: No! No, I insist. I've accompanied you to much more dangerous places before, and I assure you I won't be a burden. And...I need to do this.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: I still have a few things to tidy away before I leave, so I'll meet you at the bridge in a bit.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: There you are! Now, if you'll show me the way?

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Ah, the Ladder! I've never used it before. This will be an adventure!

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: The view is different outside of the village. Maybe I can find the perspective I need.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: It's massive! How in the world did you get this moving?

dialogue.name: Q5
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: With a great deal of help.

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: I don't quite understand it myself. Luckily, I have people for that.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Well, go on! Tell me all about it!

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: I had no idea all of that happened in Eulmore! And the Talos...marvelous!

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: I wish I had your ability to bring out the best in people. Maybe then Komra wouldn't be...

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Never mind. I thank you for your enlightening tale. And now...we descend!

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Far be it from me to complain after having insisted upon accompanying you, but...are we there yet?

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Eastward it is, then.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Deep breaths, Konogg. Just act natural. Confident. You can do this. ...Yaaah!

dialogue.name: THEVA
dialogue.text: Forename! Good to see you.

dialogue.name: THEVA
dialogue.text: Who's your friend? He seems...eager.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: L-Lali-ho! I would like some mead! Please! Ma'am!

dialogue.name: THEVA
dialogue.text: Well, I can't say “no” to one who asks so nicely...and any friend of Forename's is welcome here. I'll bring out our finest.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Did you see? I did it! Ah, it feels so good to be working toward a goal again...

dialogue.name: THEVA
dialogue.text: Here we are.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Thank you, ma'am! I think this should be sufficient payment...

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Let's hurry back. As exhilarating as this adventure has been, I want to make a gift of the mead right away.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Would you like to come with me? When I deliver the mead, I mean.

dialogue.name: Q6
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A6
dialogue.text: Someone has to look out for you.

dialogue.name: A6
dialogue.text: Of course I will.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: I appreciate it. I admit that I'm a bit nervous... But this is my chance to help, if only in a small way, so I have to take it.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Excuse us! We, um...we wanted to offer our best wishes. And...my sincere apology, as well.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: I know it doesn't come close to making up for what you've been through, but I brought you this. I thought that maybe you could share it...later...

dialogue.name: VILLAGERG03954
dialogue.text: Go away. We don't want anything from you.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERG03954
dialogue.text: All I want is for you to sod off so that me and my wife never have to see you again!

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: I'm sorry...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Konogg sounded to be in considerable distress. You had best follow him lest he come to harm.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The bottle of mead that Konogg had so earnestly wished would cheer the unfortunate couple now lies forlorn.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: (-???-)Lali-we've got another situation in our beards-ho!

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Konogg just ran right past me toward the crater. I don't know about you, but I'd really rather not have him there by himself─especially not when he's so upset. I could hear the sobs from yalms away...

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: What's that all about?

dialogue.name: Q7
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A7
dialogue.text: There's this injured woman...

dialogue.name: A7
dialogue.text: The villagers still blame him for all of it...

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Hmm... It's a tragic state of affairs all around.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: The man you met─his wife was with child before her injury. Can't blame him for lashing out, given the circumstances.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: But that doesn't mean Konogg deserves to take the brunt of it all.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: I'd consider it a personal favor if you'd find him and tell him so. ...Another personal favor, at any rate.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: He's not the most athletic dwarf I've ever met, so with any luck he won't have gotten far while we've been talking.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: I'll go and have a word with certain folks in the village. See if we can't repair some of the damage that's been done.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: I've never seen Konogg so worked up. I hope he's all right...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You find no sign of the dwarf you seek─a state of affairs that you are becoming all too familiar with.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You've still to see so much as a wisp of beard disappearing round the corner. Konogg must be further down.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: A-Anogg...

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Anogg! Look over here!

dialogue.name: ANOGG
dialogue.text: Don't run off, Konogg! It's dangerous. Let your big sister take the lead.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Waugh!

dialogue.name: ANOGG
dialogue.text: Wicked white! Konogg, move!

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: A-Anogg? Anogg! Are you down there? I'm coming!

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Anogg! Answer me!

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: No...

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: A-Anogg...? Are you behind this...thing?

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Anogg, please! Say something!

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Wh-What?

dialogue.name: ANOGG
dialogue.text: (-Dwarf Facsimile-)◇! ○※□×※▽○!

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Anogg! It's you...isn't it?

dialogue.name: ANOGG
dialogue.text: (-Dwarf Facsimile-)Ko...nogg.

dialogue.name: Q8
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A8
dialogue.text: That thing from the orb can't be Anogg. I'm sorry.

dialogue.name: A8
dialogue.text: Konogg... I think Anogg may be...

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: How do you know? How did you even know about back when she─

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Never mind. It doesn't matter. Anogg is what matters. Anogg, she...

dialogue.name: Q9
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A9
dialogue.text: I know. But you can't stay here.

dialogue.name: A9
dialogue.text: Let's go home and take some time to think, all right?

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Fine...

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Sorry... I'm fine. Everything's fine.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: I just...need to be by myself for a while.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Tell me you found him.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: What's the matter?

dialogue.name: Q10
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A10
dialogue.text: I'm afraid something has happened to Anogg...

dialogue.name: A10
dialogue.text: I don't know what I saw, but...

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: ...She fell from a cliff, you say? And then when she reappeared from this “orb” there wasn't a scratch on her?

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: I admit that sounds bad. But I found those two in these very tunnels myself, years ago.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: They were a pair of troublemakers since the start, and they've always been a little strange, to be sure. They have good hearts, though─both of them.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Anogg's too headstrong to let a little tumble keep her down. And I'm certain she'll be back with us before you know it.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: As for the orb...I haven't the slightest idea, so don't you go prodding it. And keep it quiet for now. We may not be able to keep Konogg from dashing off again later, but we can preserve the peace for now.
